transcription.text:
Speaker 1: Mr. Bradford, yes, but thank you so much for calling in and just deal with me as you go.

Speaker 2: I'll be here for a while.

Speaker 1: I've been here for some time as a veteran.

Speaker 2: I take a lot of pride in honoring my work, but I'm so sorry for the snafu.

Speaker 1: It looks like the previous rep, he didn't set it up where you just call in or you click

Speaker 2: a button, but I did.

Speaker 1: I made a correction.

Speaker 2: I apologize for that.

Speaker 1: Plus, Dr. Wright has ordered the pharmacy, so I did three things.

Speaker 2: The first thing I did is I put a stop to any and all monthly shipments.

Speaker 1: The second thing is I insured and I put a stop to any and all monthly refills.

Speaker 2: And the third thing I did is I put a stop to any and all monthly charges and I paused

Speaker 1: the prescription and I set it up as an elite status where you can call me or click a button

Speaker 2: to get a refill, right?

Speaker 1: And how you do that is my number is 1-800, because you called the pharmacy, right?

Speaker 2: 675 and it's 9807, Mr. Bradford?

Speaker 1: Are you there?

Speaker 2: That's the number I called, the 675-9807.

Speaker 1: Okay, cool.

Speaker 2: So just keep in mind that my direct extension is 0037, Mr. Bradford.

Speaker 1: So when you call that number again, if you need anything, you call me, just dial that

Speaker 2: number.

Speaker 1: Don't ever leave a voicemail because I don't chase voicemails.

Speaker 2: I get up from time to time, they'll use the restroom, you know, as my prostate, but, you

Speaker 1: know, I'm working on that.

Speaker 2: But nevertheless, call me if you need anything.

Speaker 1: What I also did is I, when you get a chance, right, you log into scoreblue.com and you

Speaker 2: use your Hotmail, right, the D.H., right, Bradford at Hotmail, log in, you're going

Speaker 1: to see a category that I put, it says your prescription.

Speaker 2: There's a red button with white font that says quick refill, okay?

Speaker 1: So you can use that at your leisure and have full autonomy.

Speaker 2: The only thing in Utah, legally, is we're not authorized to send you one refill, more

Speaker 1: than one refill per month or within a 30-day period and no less than two refills a year.

Speaker 2: So as long as it's 20 refills a year sometime or every six months or something like that,

Speaker 1: just click that button and we'll be, we'll take care of you, all right?

Speaker 2: I'm sorry about that snafu, sir, but call me if you need anything, all right?

Speaker 1: I'll make sure I made it right.

Speaker 2: Okay.

Speaker 1: Okay, sir.

Speaker 2: But just remember, Mr. Bradford, KT Goodrich, all right?

Speaker 1: You take care now.

Speaker 2: You be good.

Speaker 1: Bye.

Speaker 2: Have fun.

Speaker 1: Bye-bye.
